page.title: 07Education in Kensworth Area
page.content: Children in Whipsnade between 5 and 9 years travel by coach to Studham School and children in Kensworth attend their village school.Kensworth school has 74 on roll,3 teachers,and 2 other staff.The hours are from 9am-3.15pm.At the age of 9 years the children move on to Middle Schools in Dunstable and at 13 years transfer to Upper Schools.Again coaches are provided by the local authority for transport.Children may leave school at 16 years or go to Sixth Form College for further education and then on to University or Polytechnic if they are of academic standard.As well as the state education system,to which everyone is entitled,some people prefer to pay for their children's education.There are several private schools within easy reach but some board at those farther afield.
